info.name: Transverse dural venous sinus
info.description: The transverse dural venous sinuses pass laterally from the confluence of the sinuses at the occipital protuberance. They travel along the posterolateral attached margins of the cerebellar tentorium and empty into or become the sigmoid sinuses as they approach the petrous portion of the temporal bone.  Often the left transverse sinus is larger than its counterpart of the right.
